elements.content: The assembly of enantiopure tetrazoles with cupric ion gives rise to five homochiral zeolitic tetrazolate frameworks with rich topological nets, in which similar enantiopure porphyrin-like Cu­(5-eatz)2 subunits (SBUs) are captured in situ and play different roles.
elements.clean_text: The assembly of enantiopure tetrazoles with cupric ion gives rise to five homochiral zeolitic tetrazolate frameworks with rich topological nets, in which similar enantiopure porphyrin-like Cu(5-eatz)2 subunits (SBUs) are captured in situ and play different roles.

elements.content: The assembly of enantiopure tetrazole with cupric ion gives rise to five homochiral zeolitic frameworks with rich topological nets, in which similar enantiopure porphyrin-like Cu­(5-eatz)2 subunits (secondary building units, SBUs) are captured in situ and play different roles.
elements.clean_text: The assembly of enantiopure tetrazole with cupric ion gives rise to five homochiral zeolitic frameworks with rich topological nets, in which similar enantiopure porphyrin-like Cu(5-eatz)2 subunits (secondary building units, SBUs) are captured in situ and play different roles.

elements.content: Homochiral metal–organic frameworks (HMOFs) have attracted great interest due to their promising application in heterogeneous asymmetric catalysis, enantioselective separation, and fluorescence sensing. Among numerous HMOFs with diverse structural features, homochiral zeolitic MOFs (HZMOFs) with 4-connected zeotype topologies continue to attract increasing attention due to their high stability. Currently, although the fruits of HMOFs have been reported, the development of HZMOFs is still in its early stage.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Homochiral metal-organic frameworks (HMOFs) have attracted great interest due to their promising application in heterogeneous asymmetric catalysis, enantioselective separation, and fluorescence sensing. Among numerous HMOFs with diverse structural features, homochiral zeolitic MOFs (HZMOFs) with 4-connected zeotype topologies continue to attract increasing attention due to their high stability. Currently, although the fruits of HMOFs have been reported, the development of HZMOFs is still in its early stage.

elements.content: Tremendous efforts have proven that the self-assembly of enantiopure organic ligands with metal ions is the most promising route to construct HMOFs. Recently, some HZMOFs have been successfully synthesized from enantiopure imidazole ligands by our research group. Our works also prove that tetrazoles with different substituents can be used to construct ZMOFs.
elements.clean_text: Tremendous efforts have proven that the self-assembly of enantiopure organic ligands with metal ions is the most promising route to construct HMOFs. Recently, some HZMOFs have been successfully synthesized from enantiopure imidazole ligands by our research group. Our works also prove that tetrazoles with different substituents can be used to construct ZMOFs.

elements.content: In our previous work, we found the coordination of enantiopure tetrazoles with Cu ions is predictable. For example, (1S)-1-(5-tetrazolyl) ethylamine (5-eatz) is easy to assemble with Cu ions into Cu­(5-eatz)2 subunits (SBUs), which possess the cis- and trans- configurations as shown in . Such Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBUs can act as linear and 4-connected nodes under different conditions. Keeping this in mind, it would be a feasible access to build HZMOFs by utilizing these enantiopure Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBUs as the building units.
elements.clean_text: In our previous work, we found the coordination of enantiopure tetrazoles with Cu ions is predictable. For example, (1S)-1-(5-tetrazolyl) ethylamine (5-eatz) is easy to assemble with Cu ions into Cu(5-eatz)2 subunits (SBUs), which possess the cis- and trans- configurations as shown in . Such Cu(5-eatz)2 SBUs can act as linear and 4-connected nodes under different conditions. Keeping this in mind, it would be a feasible access to build HZMOFs by utilizing these enantiopure Cu(5-eatz)2 SBUs as the building units.

elements.clean_text: 1  (a) The Cis Cu(5-eatz)2 Subunit and (b) the Trans Cu(5-eatz)2 Subunit

elements.content: On the basis of this consideration, by using the enantiopure tetrazole ligands (1S)-1-(5-tetrazolyl)­ethylamine (5-eatz) or (1S)-1-(5-tetrazolyl)­isobutylamine (5-iatz) to assemble with copper salts, we successfully synthesized five HZTFs, CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2­(CN–)­(I–) (1), CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2­(CN–)­(Cl–) (2), [CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2­(CN–)2(H2O)]­·H2O (3), [CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2­(CN–)2(H2O)2]­·2H2O (4), and CuICuII­(5-iatz)2(I–) (5). In these compounds, the Cu­(tetrazolate)2 SBU with cis- or trans-configuration can be obtained under different conditions. Then by adjusting the anions as auxiliary ligands, we can tune the final frameworks with different topological nets. These results show that it is an effective way to synthesize new HZMOFs.
elements.clean_text: On the basis of this consideration, by using the enantiopure tetrazole ligands (1S)-1-(5-tetrazolyl)ethylamine (5-eatz) or (1S)-1-(5-tetrazolyl)isobutylamine (5-iatz) to assemble with copper salts, we successfully synthesized five HZTFs, CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2(CN-)(I-) (1), CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2(CN-)(Cl-) (2), [CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2(CN-)2(H2O)]⋅H2O (3), [CuI 2CuII(5-eatz)2(CN-)2(H2O)2]⋅2H2O (4), and CuICuII(5-iatz)2(I-) (5). In these compounds, the Cu(tetrazolate)2 SBU with cis- or trans-configuration can be obtained under different conditions. Then by adjusting the anions as auxiliary ligands, we can tune the final frameworks with different topological nets. These results show that it is an effective way to synthesize new HZMOFs.

elements.content: Orange crystals of 1 (and 2) were obtained by hydrothermal reaction of 5-eatz, Na4[Fe­(CN)6], CuI (CuCl for 2), and KI (KCl for 2) at 100 °C. Compounds 1 and 2 present the isostructural frameworks with different terminal ligands (I– for 1and Cl–for 2). Both of them crystallize in the monoclinic crystal system with the C2 space group. Therefore, only compound 1 will be discussed in detail. The asymmetric unit of 1 contains three independent Cu ions (a). Cu2 is coordinated by two 5-eatz ligands to form a Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU in trans-configuration. Meanwhile, Cu3 and Cu1 are tetrahedrally coordinated by two N atoms from two 5-eatz, one CN– dissociated from Na4[Fe­(CN)6], and one μ2-I– anion. The Cu1 and Cu3 are linked by the μ2-I– anion to form the Cu2I SBU. Then each Cu2I SBU is linked by two Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBUs and two CN– to generate a three-dimensional (3D) framework (c). So the Cu2I can be considered as the 4-connected node, the Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU and CN– can be treated as the linkers (b). In this way the whole framework can be simplified as the 3-fold interpenetrated dia net (d).
elements.clean_text:
Structure Descriptions

Orange crystals of 1 (and 2) were obtained by hydrothermal reaction of 5-eatz, Na4[Fe(CN)6], CuI (CuCl for 2), and KI (KCl for 2) at 100 °C. Compounds 1 and 2 present the isostructural frameworks with different terminal ligands (I- for 1and Cl-for 2). Both of them crystallize in the monoclinic crystal system with the C2 space group. Therefore, only compound 1 will be discussed in detail. The asymmetric unit of 1 contains three independent Cu ions (a). Cu2 is coordinated by two 5-eatz ligands to form a Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU in trans-configuration. Meanwhile, Cu3 and Cu1 are tetrahedrally coordinated by two N atoms from two 5-eatz, one CN- dissociated from Na4[Fe(CN)6], and one μ2-I- anion. The Cu1 and Cu3 are linked by the μ2-I- anion to form the Cu2I SBU. Then each Cu2I SBU is linked by two Cu(5-eatz)2 SBUs and two CN- to generate a three-dimensional (3D) framework (c). So the Cu2I can be considered as the 4-connected node, the Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU and CN- can be treated as the linkers (b). In this way the whole framework can be simplified as the 3-fold interpenetrated  dia  net (d).

elements.content: (a) The coordinate environment of compound 1 and 2, (b) the dia cage, (c) the 3D framework of compound 1, (d) the 3-fold interpenetration dia topology in 1.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) The coordinate environment of compound 1 and 2, (b) the  dia  cage, (c) the 3D framework of compound 1, (d) the 3-fold interpenetration  dia  topology in 1.

elements.content: In comparison, dark blue crystals of 3 were obtained by using Cu­(NO3)2 as copper salts under similar conditions. Compound 3 also crystallizes in the monoclinic crystal system with the C2 space group, but the asymmetric unit of 3 just contains two independent Cu ions (a). A similar Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU in trans-configuration is observed. The slight difference is that the center Cu1 atom is six coordinated, and two axial positions are occupied by two water molecules. The Cu2 is tetrahedrally coordinated by two N atoms from two 5-eatz ligands and two CN–. Similarly, in compound 1, the Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU also coordinate to four Cu atoms; however, it is more reasonable to be a planar 4-connected node because of the absence of the μ2-I– anion (b). The CN– acts as the linker and the tetrahedral Cu2 acts as a tetrahedral 4-connected node. So compound 3 has a 4-connected mog -type 3D framework (b,d).
elements.clean_text: In comparison, dark blue crystals of 3 were obtained by using Cu(NO3)2 as copper salts under similar conditions. Compound 3 also crystallizes in the monoclinic crystal system with the C2 space group, but the asymmetric unit of 3 just contains two independent Cu ions (a). A similar Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU in trans-configuration is observed. The slight difference is that the center Cu1 atom is six coordinated, and two axial positions are occupied by two water molecules. The Cu2 is tetrahedrally coordinated by two N atoms from two 5-eatz ligands and two CN-. Similarly, in compound 1, the Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU also coordinate to four Cu atoms; however, it is more reasonable to be a planar 4-connected node because of the absence of the μ2-I- anion (b). The CN- acts as the linker and the tetrahedral Cu2 acts as a tetrahedral 4-connected node. So compound 3 has a 4-connected  mog -type 3D framework (b,d).

elements.clean_text: 2  (a) The coordinate environment of compound 3, (b) the  mog  cage of compound 3, (c) the 3D framework of compound 3, (d) the  mog  topology of compound 3.

elements.content: Purple crystals of 4 based on cis-Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU were synthesized under similar conditions of 3 in the absence of ethanol. Compound 4 crystallizes in the hexagonal crystal system with space groups of P3121, and it includes three independent Cu ions in the asymmetric unit. The Cu3 atom is coordinated by two 5-eatz ligands to form the cis-Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU. And the Cu3 atom shows almost the same coordination mode as that in compound 3. Interestingly, cis-Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU is chelated to another Cu2 atom by using the two N atoms from two 5-eatz ligands, giving a new Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBU. Each Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBU is coordinated to four Cu1 atoms as the distorted tetrahedral node (b). And the Cu1 is also as the tetrahedral node because it is linked by two CN– and two Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBUs. Thus, compound 4 exhibits a 4-connected qtz -type framework (d).
elements.clean_text: Purple crystals of 4 based on cis-Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU were synthesized under similar conditions of 3 in the absence of ethanol. Compound 4 crystallizes in the hexagonal crystal system with space groups of P3121, and it includes three independent Cu ions in the asymmetric unit. The Cu3 atom is coordinated by two 5-eatz ligands to form the cis-Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU. And the Cu3 atom shows almost the same coordination mode as that in compound 3. Interestingly, cis-Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU is chelated to another Cu2 atom by using the two N atoms from two 5-eatz ligands, giving a new Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBU. Each Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBU is coordinated to four Cu1 atoms as the distorted tetrahedral node (b). And the Cu1 is also as the tetrahedral node because it is linked by two CN- and two Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBUs. Thus, compound 4 exhibits a 4-connected  qtz -type framework (d).

elements.content: (a) Coordinate environment of compound 4, (b) two kinds of tetrahedral nodes of Cu ion and the Cu2(5-eatz)2 structure in compound 4, (c) the 3D framework of compound 4, (d) the qtz topology of compound 4.
elements.clean_text: 3  (a) Coordinate environment of compound 4, (b) two kinds of tetrahedral nodes of Cu ion and the Cu2(5-eatz)2 structure in compound 4, (c) the 3D framework of compound 4, (d) the  qtz  topology of compound 4.

elements.content: By employing 5-iatz as the ligand, orange crystals of 5 were achieved, and it crystallizes in the orthorhombic P212121 space group. There are two independent Cu ions in the asymmetric unit of 5 (a). The Cu1 atom is coordinated by two 5-iatz ligands to form the cis-Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU. Then the cis-Cu­(5-iatz)2 SBU is chelated to another Cu2 atom to generate the Cu2(5-iatz)2 SBU. Differently,the I– anion is pendent on Cu2 atom as the terminal ligand, and Cu1 adopts square pyramidal coordination geometry, which is coordinated by one N atom from a 5-iatz ligand on the axial position. So the new Cu2(5-iatz)2I SBU is formed, and it can also be treated as the distorted tetrahedral node (b). With the lack of CN–, the Cu2(5-iatz)2I SBU cross-links each other to form the 3D framework with dia topology (c,d).
elements.clean_text: By employing 5-iatz as the ligand, orange crystals of 5 were achieved, and it crystallizes in the orthorhombic P212121 space group. There are two independent Cu ions in the asymmetric unit of 5 (a). The Cu1 atom is coordinated by two 5-iatz ligands to form the cis-Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU. Then the cis-Cu(5-iatz)2 SBU is chelated to another Cu2 atom to generate the Cu2(5-iatz)2 SBU. Differently,the I- anion is pendent on Cu2 atom as the terminal ligand, and Cu1 adopts square pyramidal coordination geometry, which is coordinated by one N atom from a 5-iatz ligand on the axial position. So the new Cu2(5-iatz)2I SBU is formed, and it can also be treated as the distorted tetrahedral node (b). With the lack of CN-, the Cu2(5-iatz)2I SBU cross-links each other to form the 3D framework with  dia  topology (c,d).

elements.content: (a) The coordinate environment of compound 5, (b) the tetrahedral Cu2(5-eatz)2 structure of compound 5, (c) the 3D framework of compound 5, (d) the dia topology of compound 5.
elements.clean_text: 4  (a) The coordinate environment of compound 5, (b) the tetrahedral Cu2(5-eatz)2 structure of compound 5, (c) the 3D framework of compound 5, (d) the  dia  topology of compound 5.

elements.content: To better understand such interesting HZMOFs, we will discuss them together. All of the compounds are mixed valence framework, which can be proven by X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS) characterization (Figure S4). There are four different nets found in these compounds in total. The 3-fold interpenetrated dia net in 1 is composed of a Cu2I tetrahedral node, and two different linkers, trans-Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU and CN–. While in 3, trans-Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU acts as the planar 4-connected node, and single Cu atom acts as the tetrahedral node, so it has the mog net. Differently, cis-Cu­(5-eatz)2 SBU is found in 4, which further coordinates to one Cu atom to form a new Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBU as distorted tetrahedral node. Such a difference results in the final net from mog to qtz . Compared to 4, the Cu2(5-iatz)2I SBU is formed in 5 because the terminal I– anion replaces the μ2-CN–. Just one kind of distorted tetrahedral node with large constituents forms the dia net without interpenetration. For these compounds, we can steadily synthesize similar components Cu­(tetrazolate)2 SBU with cis- or trans-configuration under different conditions. Then by adjusting the anions as auxiliary ligands, we can further tune the exact components of the SBUs and the linkage between different nodes, making the final frameworks with various topological nets. These results demonstrate that this strategy is very effective in the construction of novel HZMOFs.
elements.clean_text:
Structure Comparison

To better understand such interesting HZMOFs, we will discuss them together. All of the compounds are mixed valence framework, which can be proven by X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS) characterization (Figure S4). There are four different nets found in these compounds in total. The 3-fold interpenetrated  dia  net in 1 is composed of a Cu2I tetrahedral node, and two different linkers, trans-Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU and CN-. While in 3, trans-Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU acts as the planar 4-connected node, and single Cu atom acts as the tetrahedral node, so it has the  mog  net. Differently, cis-Cu(5-eatz)2 SBU is found in 4, which further coordinates to one Cu atom to form a new Cu2(5-eatz)2 SBU as distorted tetrahedral node. Such a difference results in the final net from  mog  to  qtz . Compared to 4, the Cu2(5-iatz)2I SBU is formed in 5 because the terminal I- anion replaces the μ2-CN-. Just one kind of distorted tetrahedral node with large constituents forms the  dia  net without interpenetration. For these compounds, we can steadily synthesize similar components Cu(tetrazolate)2 SBU with cis- or trans-configuration under different conditions. Then by adjusting the anions as auxiliary ligands, we can further tune the exact components of the SBUs and the linkage between different nodes, making the final frameworks with various topological nets. These results demonstrate that this strategy is very effective in the construction of novel HZMOFs.

elements.content: Assembly of zeolitic chiral tetrazolate frameworks from Cu­(5-eatz)2 or Cu2(5-eatz)2 subunits.
elements.clean_text: 5  Assembly of zeolitic chiral tetrazolate frameworks from Cu(5-eatz)2 or Cu2(5-eatz)2 subunits.

elements.content: In conclusion, the enantiopure porphyrin-like Cu­(tetrazolate)2 SBUs can be widely used to construct new HZMOFs with various nets. This work proves that it is an effective method to construct HZMOFs for future applications.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In conclusion, the enantiopure porphyrin-like Cu(tetrazolate)2 SBUs can be widely used to construct new HZMOFs with various nets. This work proves that it is an effective method to construct HZMOFs for future applications.

metadata.title:
Synthesis of Homochiral
Zeolitic Tetrazolate Frameworks
Based on Enantiopure Porphyrin-like Subunits
